data:
1
00:00:44,448 --> 00:00:47,728
People once believed
that when someone dies...

2
00:00:47,804 --> 00:00:51,928
a crow carries their soul
to the land of the dead.

3
00:00:52,005 --> 00:00:55,208
But sometimes,
something so bad happens...

4
00:00:55,285 --> 00:01:00,320
that a terrible sadness is carried
with it and the soul can't rest.

5
00:01:00,406 --> 00:01:03,322
Then sometimes,
just sometimes...

6
00:01:03,408 --> 00:01:08,203
the crow can bring that soul back
to put the wrong things right.

7
00:01:49,528 --> 00:01:51,926
Over here.

8
00:01:52,002 --> 00:01:55,848
There's a piece of glass.

9
00:01:55,925 --> 00:01:57,968
Hey, Sarge!

10
00:01:58,006 --> 00:02:00,164
Yeah?

11
00:02:00,241 --> 00:02:04,566
Shelly Webster and Eric Draven.
Wedding was tomorrow night.

12
00:02:04,643 --> 00:02:07,759
Who the fuck gets married
on Halloween anyhow?

13
00:02:07,846 --> 00:02:09,687
Nobody.

14
00:02:11,202 --> 00:02:15,000
- Sir, we gotta move her.
- Do it.

15
00:02:15,086 --> 00:02:17,244
All right, guys,
let's do it.

16
00:02:17,321 --> 00:02:20,400
Devil's fucking Night.
What's the count so far?

17
00:02:20,486 --> 00:02:21,800
143 fires.

18
00:02:21,848 --> 00:02:24,562
- They're slacking off from last year.
- Three hours to go.

19
00:02:24,648 --> 00:02:29,328
- Maybe they're just slow starters.
- Coming through!

20
00:02:32,167 --> 00:02:35,361
You guys can't come in here
and take her away like this.

21
00:02:35,447 --> 00:02:40,041
There are procedures. You should have
cleared this with me first.

22
00:02:40,127 --> 00:02:42,323
- Is this the victim?
- No, it's Amelia Earhart.

23
00:02:42,362 --> 00:02:45,124
- We found her, and you missed it.
- I don't care what her name is.

24
00:02:45,200 --> 00:02:47,684
I didn't give the order to move her.
Jesus, Albrecht.

25
00:02:47,761 --> 00:02:51,079
I can see why they took away
your gold shield.

26
00:02:51,166 --> 00:02:54,043
Yeah, I wasn't a big enough asshole.
Come on. Let's go.

27
00:02:54,119 --> 00:02:55,961
All right, clear out.

28
00:02:57,284 --> 00:02:59,768
- Shelly?
- Stand back, kid.

29
00:03:01,926 --> 00:03:05,964
- Where's Eric?
- Just don't worry about him.

30
00:03:06,040 --> 00:03:08,160
Tell him to take care
of Sarah.

31
00:03:08,246 --> 00:03:12,006
Look, I will.
You just, uh, lie back. Come on.

32
00:03:21,606 --> 00:03:24,320
- You Sarah?
- Yeah.

33
00:03:24,406 --> 00:03:28,280
Yeah, look. Your sister,
she's gonna be okay.

34
00:03:28,328 --> 00:03:31,484
She's not my sister.
Shelly just takes care of me.

35
00:03:31,522 --> 00:03:33,766
She's my friend.

36
00:03:33,843 --> 00:03:37,602
Her and Eric.

37
00:03:37,641 --> 00:03:39,808
You lied to her about Eric.

38
00:03:39,885 --> 00:03:41,400
I had to.

39
00:03:41,486 --> 00:03:45,044
And you're lying
to me about Shelly.

40
00:03:45,121 --> 00:03:47,365
She's gonna die,
isn't she?

41
00:03:47,404 --> 00:03:51,844
Hey, uh...

42
00:03:56,045 --> 00:04:01,521
Now, come on.
Come on. It's okay.

43
00:04:01,645 --> 00:04:04,925
She's gonna be fine.

44
00:04:23,042 --> 00:04:26,926
A building gets torch ed.
All that is left is ashes.

45
00:04:27,002 --> 00:04:29,764
I used to think that was true
about everything...

46
00:04:29,841 --> 00:04:34,080
families, friends, feelings.

47
00:04:34,128 --> 00:04:37,926
But now I know that sometimes,
if love proves real...

48
00:04:37,964 --> 00:04:42,165
two people who are meant to be together,
nothing can keep them apart.

49
00:05:06,927 --> 00:05:09,804
Later.

50
00:05:18,848 --> 00:05:21,927
What are you,
like the night watchman?

51
00:05:42,364 --> 00:05:45,605
You know, what this place
needs is a...

52
00:05:45,682 --> 00:05:47,926
good natural catastrophe.

53
00:05:48,003 --> 00:05:52,242
- Earthquake, tornado, you know.
- No, no, no, no.

54
00:05:52,280 --> 00:05:55,167
Mickey, come on, man. You got to put
the mustard underneath first.

55
00:05:55,244 --> 00:05:57,440
Maybe a flood like in the Bible.

56
00:05:57,526 --> 00:06:00,442
Hey, hey, let me do it.

57
00:06:00,528 --> 00:06:04,403
There we go. All right.
How about some onions?

58
00:06:04,441 --> 00:06:06,800
Come on, man.
Don't cheap out on me.

59
00:06:06,848 --> 00:06:08,728
- Lots of onions.
- All right, here you go.

60
00:06:08,766 --> 00:06:11,087
Hey, all right.

61
00:06:11,164 --> 00:06:13,446
Now we're talking.

62
00:06:13,523 --> 00:06:18,040
Hey, it's the Sarah monster.

63
00:06:18,126 --> 00:06:21,800
- How do you steer that on a wet street?
- Pure talent. Hi.

64
00:06:21,886 --> 00:06:25,645
Now, Sarah, she's a genuine hot dogger.
You hungry?

65
00:06:25,722 --> 00:06:27,448
- You buying?
- I'm buying.

66
00:06:27,525 --> 00:06:31,045
- No onions though, okay?
- No onions?

67
00:06:31,121 --> 00:06:34,200
They make you fart big time.

68
00:06:40,280 --> 00:06:42,879
You know, Lake Erie
actually caught on fire once...

69
00:06:42,966 --> 00:06:45,488
from all the crap
floating around in it.

70
00:06:46,600 --> 00:06:50,206
I wish I could have seen that.

71
00:07:48,046 --> 00:07:52,362
Fire it up! Yeah!

72
00:08:29,879 --> 00:08:33,648
- All right, we busted their machines!
- Shit!

73
00:08:55,687 --> 00:08:58,919
Oh, oh, shit, guys.
T- bird, cop car, cop car.

74
00:09:05,882 --> 00:09:08,366
Bad people out
on the street tonight.

75
00:09:14,168 --> 00:09:16,000
- Damn it!
- What was that?

76
00:09:16,086 --> 00:09:18,647
- You wait right here.
- Be careful.

77
00:09:18,723 --> 00:09:21,888
Mickey, call it in for me!

78
00:10:39,206 --> 00:10:42,160
Gabriel!

79
00:10:51,961 --> 00:10:54,925
- Eric?
- Department of Housing!

80
00:10:55,001 --> 00:10:59,327
Code violations?
Safety hazards?

81
00:10:59,403 --> 00:11:01,523
Place looks fine to me.

82
00:11:01,561 --> 00:11:04,285
Let's redecorate.

83
00:11:06,682 --> 00:11:10,682
"Abash, the devil stood...

84
00:11:10,720 --> 00:11:13,319
and felt how awful
goodness is.

85
00:11:13,405 --> 00:11:17,807
Saw virtue in her shape, how lovely."
It's pornography.

86
00:11:18,881 --> 00:11:22,602
Virtue?

87
00:11:22,679 --> 00:11:25,527
Shelly?

88
00:11:27,407 --> 00:11:30,361

- See ya!

89
00:11:30,399 --> 00:11:33,046
No, no, no, me first.

90
00:11:35,003 --> 00:11:37,161
Please.

91
00:11:38,724 --> 00:11:41,160
- Shelly.
- Eric!

92
00:12:18,888 --> 00:12:21,679
- Hey, that's good.
- That's good.

93
00:12:25,400 --> 00:12:28,843
See if you can top that, man.
Can you top that?

94
00:12:28,920 --> 00:12:30,761
Look at that.
Look at that.

95
00:12:32,047 --> 00:12:36,324
Here's to Devil's Night,
my new favorite holiday.

96
00:12:39,844 --> 00:12:41,762
You go over there
and talk to your pals...

97
00:12:41,800 --> 00:12:44,802
You sick fuck.

98
00:12:44,840 --> 00:12:48,408
Are you out of
your motherfucking mind, man?

99
00:12:51,525 --> 00:12:55,725
Look at that!

100
00:12:57,845 --> 00:12:59,801
Pussies drink last, man.

101
00:13:01,000 --> 00:13:03,321
- Fuck you, Tin Tin.
- Hey.

102
00:13:04,683 --> 00:13:07,080
Shit ain't
even loaded, man.

103
00:13:07,167 --> 00:13:09,248
This one is.

104
00:13:09,324 --> 00:13:12,125
Which of you Motor City
motherfuckers...

105
00:13:12,202 --> 00:13:16,325
wants to bet me
this one isn't?

106
00:13:16,402 --> 00:13:20,123
Hey, fire it up!
Fire it up!

107
00:13:20,200 --> 00:13:23,163
- Fire it up! - Fire
it up! - Fire it up!

108
00:13:23,240 --> 00:13:25,925
Fire it up! Fire it up!

109
00:13:26,002 --> 00:13:28,966
Here's your shooters.

110
00:13:29,042 --> 00:13:30,922
- Put your guns away, huh, guys?
- How ya doing?

111
00:13:31,008 --> 00:13:34,528
Pussycat.

112
00:13:53,805 --> 00:13:57,200
Boo.

113
00:14:04,882 --> 00:14:08,248
- I love you.
- Say that again.

114
00:14:08,325 --> 00:14:10,482
I love you.

115
00:14:10,559 --> 00:14:13,599
Oh, boy.

116
00:14:13,686 --> 00:14:16,965
Restaurant.

117
00:14:21,444 --> 00:14:24,484
- Wow, you look great.
- Ta-da!

118
00:14:27,525 --> 00:14:31,207
Yeah!

119
00:14:31,246 --> 00:14:33,720
- Come here!
- No, no, no!

120
00:16:07,840 --> 00:16:10,286
Couple more rings.
That's 24k.

121
00:16:10,362 --> 00:16:14,208
24k, huh? It's 18k.
It's crap. It's probably fake.

122
00:16:14,285 --> 00:16:16,519
Leather purse. Leather.

123
00:16:16,606 --> 00:16:20,921
Geez. Oh, what is this, Tin Tin?

124
00:16:21,008 --> 00:16:25,362
A blood stain
that's on here?

125
00:16:25,448 --> 00:16:27,961
I'll give you 50 bucks.
And I hate charities.

126
00:16:28,047 --> 00:16:30,761
Now, you,
take it or leave it.

127
00:16:30,847 --> 00:16:33,485
Right there for ya.

128
00:16:33,562 --> 00:16:37,762
Decisions, decisions.

129
00:16:39,239 --> 00:16:42,279
You cheap ass, chrome dome...

130
00:16:42,366 --> 00:16:45,243
...child molesting,
saprophyte motherfucker.

131
00:16:45,281 --> 00:16:47,564
Close the gate
when you go out!

132
00:16:47,640 --> 00:16:50,201
Oh, I close this up
for you real good, massa.

133
00:16:50,239 --> 00:16:52,685
Fuck you.

134
00:16:52,762 --> 00:16:56,041
Yeah, sit on it and twirl,

135
00:17:00,568 --> 00:17:04,845
Lucky I didn't stab
your fat ass.

136
00:18:45,602 --> 00:18:48,604
What the fuck you all painted

137
00:18:51,088 --> 00:18:55,164
Halloween ain't till manana.

138
00:18:58,405 --> 00:19:00,841
Come on.

139
00:19:35,443 --> 00:19:38,723
Fuck, you murderer!

140
00:19:38,800 --> 00:19:41,322
I ain't murdered nobody, man!
I don't even fucking know you!

141
00:19:41,399 --> 00:19:45,322

142
00:19:45,408 --> 00:19:48,688
A man and a woman

143
00:19:48,726 --> 00:19:51,201
- You're out of your fucking mind...
- Listen!

144
00:19:51,287 --> 00:19:55,919
I'm sure you'll remember.
You killed them... on Halloween.

145
00:19:56,005 --> 00:20:00,762
Yeah, yeah, Halloween, yeah.
Some dude, some bitch, whatever, man.

146
00:20:00,801 --> 00:20:03,160
Her name was Shelly.

147
00:20:03,246 --> 00:20:06,123
You cut her.
You raped her.

148
00:20:06,200 --> 00:20:11,762
Shelly, yeah, yeah. I shanked
her pink ass and she loved it!

149
00:20:20,605 --> 00:20:25,323
Murderer? Murderer? Let me tell you

150
00:20:25,400 --> 00:20:29,840
It's easy.
You gonna learn all about it.

151
00:20:34,367 --> 00:20:36,803

two buddies of mine.

152
00:20:36,880 --> 00:20:39,440
We never miss.

153
00:20:47,525 --> 00:20:49,520
Try harder.

154
00:20:49,606 --> 00:20:51,601

- Aaah!

155
00:20:56,482 --> 00:21:01,124

Aren't we all?

156
00:21:24,841 --> 00:21:29,003
- Look at this mess! What's the world coming to?
- It's a mess.

157
00:21:36,081 --> 00:21:38,728
I got to go upstairs.
Report from the front.

158
00:21:43,284 --> 00:21:46,448
Get out of my way,
you worms!

159
00:21:47,522 --> 00:21:49,364
Give me some of that
over there!

160
00:21:51,522 --> 00:21:55,080
Why don't you ladies come by later?
Check me out.

161
00:21:55,128 --> 00:21:59,721
Hey, guess what?
Arcade Games fell down, went boom.

162
00:21:59,760 --> 00:22:03,443
- Boom.
- Can you imagine that? It's tragic.

163
00:22:03,519 --> 00:22:07,566
Gather your soldiers.
You're on for tomorrow night. No sweat.

164
00:22:07,605 --> 00:22:11,527

- He's taking a meeting.

165
00:22:40,327 --> 00:22:43,962
You're thinking
about the past.

166
00:22:46,168 --> 00:22:48,565
Dad gave me this.

167
00:22:48,642 --> 00:22:52,641
Fifth birthday.

168
00:22:52,728 --> 00:22:57,206
He said childhood's over
the moment you know you're gonna die.

169
00:23:10,527 --> 00:23:12,887
Is she asleep?

170
00:23:18,842 --> 00:23:21,000
I think we broke her.

171
00:23:24,846 --> 00:23:26,879
I love her eyes.

172
00:23:27,886 --> 00:23:29,766
Pretty.

173
00:23:45,686 --> 00:23:48,726
Hey, kid,
get the hell outta the road!

174
00:24:06,564 --> 00:24:11,887
I told you to stay out of here.

175
00:24:11,925 --> 00:24:15,445
So I guess you're not gonna be home
till a lot later, huh, Darla?

176
00:24:15,522 --> 00:24:19,406
She's busy. Go play with your dolls
or something, okay?

177
00:24:19,444 --> 00:24:21,688
I don't have any dolls.

178
00:24:21,765 --> 00:24:25,006
Get some food, huh?

179
00:24:25,045 --> 00:24:27,922
Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police.

180
00:24:33,408 --> 00:24:36,927
- "Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police."

181
00:24:46,527 --> 00:24:49,644
Thirty, forty dollars.

182
00:24:51,322 --> 00:24:53,682
Who the fuck is this now?

183
00:24:53,720 --> 00:24:57,719
Hey! Piss off!
We're closed!

184
00:24:57,806 --> 00:25:00,366
Cerrado!

185
00:25:00,443 --> 00:25:04,126
Sleep it off somewhere else, dusthead,
unless you want to get mutilated.

186
00:25:11,405 --> 00:25:15,481
Goddamn creatures of the night,
they never learn.

187
00:25:17,121 --> 00:25:18,799
Hey! Hey!

188
00:25:22,846 --> 00:25:27,047
"Suddenly I heard
a tapping, as if someone...

189
00:25:27,085 --> 00:25:30,883
gently rapping,
rapping at my chamber door."

190
00:25:32,763 --> 00:25:34,968
What are you talking about?

191
00:25:35,045 --> 00:25:37,644
You heard me rapping, right?

192
00:25:37,721 --> 00:25:41,682
You're trespassing,
and you owe me a fucking new door!

193
00:25:44,003 --> 00:25:46,841

194
00:25:46,928 --> 00:25:48,242
Gold.

195
00:25:48,328 --> 00:25:50,562
You're looking for a coroner,
shit-for-brains.

196
00:25:54,648 --> 00:25:59,568
Oh, shit.
Oh, shit on me!

197
00:25:59,645 --> 00:26:02,080
Shit on me.
Shit on me!

198
00:26:07,959 --> 00:26:10,127
- Aaah!
- Mr. Gideon.

199

You're not paying attention.

200

No!

201

I repeat, a gold
engagement ring, yes?

202
00:26:23,966 --> 00:26:27,284
It was pawned here a year ago

203
00:26:29,883 --> 00:26:33,403
He confided in me
before he ran out of breath.

204
00:26:38,486 --> 00:26:40,404
Who's this sack of shit?

205
00:26:40,480 --> 00:26:43,319
That's Tin Tin, one of
T- bird's little helpers.

206
00:26:43,405 --> 00:26:46,321
I think you can rule out

207
00:26:46,407 --> 00:26:49,083
Don't any of your street demons
have real grown-up names?

208
00:26:49,160 --> 00:26:53,159
This could be a turf hit, but it doesn't
look like your usual gang crap.

209
00:26:53,245 --> 00:26:57,762
Come on, Albrecht, spare me.
You're a beat cop now, so be a beat cop.

210
00:26:57,839 --> 00:26:59,680
I'm suppose to thank you
for that, right?

211
00:26:59,767 --> 00:27:03,363
Word to the wise:
Watch your fucking mouth.

212
00:27:04,524 --> 00:27:06,844
What the hell
do you call that?

213

I call it blood, detective.

214
00:27:10,402 --> 00:27:14,047

215
00:27:14,085 --> 00:27:16,761
You can leave
my crime scene now, okay?

216
00:27:23,206 --> 00:27:26,006
- Warmer?
- What are you doing?

217
00:27:26,083 --> 00:27:28,605
- Don't you know this game?
- What game?

218
00:27:28,643 --> 00:27:31,444
Okay, the rings!
I'll tell you about the rings!

219
00:27:31,521 --> 00:27:35,721
They're in that metal box!
It's under the shelf there!

220
00:27:35,807 --> 00:27:41,082
Take the fucking rings!
Choke on them, you son of a bitch!

221
00:27:44,525 --> 00:27:46,999
- Look, it goes to the attic.
- Okay.

222
00:27:55,803 --> 00:27:57,722
No, no.

223
00:27:57,808 --> 00:28:00,800
No, no, no.

224

Oh, it's beautiful.
I don't believe it.

225

Shelly.

226

I love you.

227
00:28:30,166 --> 00:28:32,966

- Take anything you want.

228
00:28:33,043 --> 00:28:36,006

- Take anything!

229
00:28:36,083 --> 00:28:38,807
Now you're going to tell me
where to find...

230

little party pals.

231
00:28:41,483 --> 00:28:43,765
The Pit. They all
hang out at The Pit.

232
00:28:43,842 --> 00:28:48,723
T- birds's little potato-heads hang out
there. Funboy lives there upstairs.

233
00:28:48,800 --> 00:28:51,687
- Funboy.
- Oh, baby, oh.

234
00:28:51,763 --> 00:28:55,360
- A whole jolly club...
- Please!

235
00:28:55,446 --> 00:28:58,083

236
00:28:58,160 --> 00:29:00,721

237

Each one of these is a life...

238
00:29:05,641 --> 00:29:08,048

239

Don't kill me.

240
00:29:10,685 --> 00:29:14,243

241
00:29:14,320 --> 00:29:18,319
Your job will be to tell the rest

242

243
00:29:26,605 --> 00:29:30,643
Tell them Eric Draven

244
00:29:32,446 --> 00:29:36,368
You walk outta here,
they're gonna erase your sorry ass.

245
00:29:36,445 --> 00:29:39,926
You're nothing but street grease,
you motherfucker!

00:29:40,003 --> 00:29:42,046

247
00:29:42,123 --> 00:29:44,961
No, man, no!
No!

248
00:29:45,000 --> 00:29:47,004
No!

249
00:29:47,042 --> 00:29:48,328
No!

250

It's on the house, kiddo,

251

252

253

254
00:30:17,962 --> 00:30:20,005

255

Police! Don't move!
I said, "Don't move!"

256

257
00:30:32,165 --> 00:30:35,925

258
00:30:36,001 --> 00:30:40,960

259
00:30:41,008 --> 00:30:44,201
Not one more step.

260
00:30:44,240 --> 00:30:48,440

Officer Albrecht.

261
00:30:48,527 --> 00:30:51,528

262
00:30:51,605 --> 00:30:53,245
You high?

263

264
00:30:56,448 --> 00:31:00,284

Do you remember Shelly Webster?

265
00:31:00,361 --> 00:31:02,922
Shelly Webster's dead, my friend.

266
00:31:02,960 --> 00:31:07,400

267

Okay, we're gonna

268
00:31:12,167 --> 00:31:16,444

269
00:31:16,521 --> 00:31:18,842

270
00:31:18,928 --> 00:31:23,321
He had a friend who shouldn't have

271

272

273

274

275
00:31:38,205 --> 00:31:40,526

276

Get outta here!

277

278

279

280

281

282

283

284

285

286

287

293

294
00:33:11,443 --> 00:33:13,648

295

296
00:33:18,166 --> 00:33:20,640

297

298

299
00:33:28,888 --> 00:33:31,563

300

302

303

304

305

306

307
00:34:28,645 --> 00:34:30,928

308
00:34:31,005 --> 00:34:35,119
He was a buttface.

309

310

Sometimes.

311

312
00:34:47,759 --> 00:34:51,125

313

314

316

"We, the undersigned tenants of

318

319

320
00:35:32,441 --> 00:35:38,080

322

323

324

325

327

328

Damn.

337

Here, birdie, birdie.

338
00:37:22,682 --> 00:37:25,560
Come here, birdie,

339
00:37:28,082 --> 00:37:31,160
Birdie? Hey, birdie?

344

345

349

350

387

388

392

Fuck.

394

396

397
00:43:25,804 --> 00:43:27,683
Shi...

Holy Shit.

00:44:08,241 --> 00:44:12,403

408
00:44:12,480 --> 00:44:15,568

409
00:44:15,607 --> 00:44:19,328

I couldn't do jack for her.

410

411

Hey.

412
00:44:35,919 --> 00:44:38,643

413

414

415

416

Yeah, well, you got to

417

418
00:44:58,083 --> 00:45:00,921
Give me something

419
00:45:00,960 --> 00:45:03,127
Yeah.

420
00:45:03,165 --> 00:45:05,525
Look, I...

421

422

You think any people in that building,

423
00:45:11,327 --> 00:45:14,645

424
00:45:14,722 --> 00:45:17,800

425

426

427
00:45:26,240 --> 00:45:30,527

428
00:45:32,320 --> 00:45:35,159
It's funny.

429

Little things used to mean

430
00:45:39,120 --> 00:45:42,486

431

432

435

436

440

441

442
00:46:44,440 --> 00:46:46,886

He had a guitar.

443

444
00:46:51,288 --> 00:46:56,083

Musicians.

445
00:46:56,160 --> 00:46:58,528
- What else did you see?
- So far I haven't heard...

446

shit about what you're going to do

447
00:47:01,079 --> 00:47:06,364
What do I get? My livelihood

448
00:47:06,440 --> 00:47:09,087
You ain't lost everything.

449
00:47:09,164 --> 00:47:14,046
Yeah, and maybe you're not

450
00:47:14,122 --> 00:47:17,565
Fair enough. Catch.

451

Aah! Jesus.

452
00:47:21,047 --> 00:47:23,367

453

What're you telling me,
this thing is real?

454
00:47:25,401 --> 00:47:28,920
All the power in the world

455
00:47:29,007 --> 00:47:32,804
Sometimes they're more useful

456
00:47:32,881 --> 00:47:36,842
You're directly out of
your fucking mind! You know that!

457
00:47:36,928 --> 00:47:39,479
Yeah.

458
00:47:39,527 --> 00:47:44,486
Eyes see. It's one of the most important

459
00:47:44,562 --> 00:47:47,679

460

462
00:47:53,881 --> 00:47:56,039

463
00:47:56,125 --> 00:47:59,482

464

465

466

00:48:08,526 --> 00:48:12,161

469

470
00:48:19,804 --> 00:48:24,005

471
00:48:24,043 --> 00:48:26,642

472
00:48:26,719 --> 00:48:31,044

473

474
00:48:39,282 --> 00:48:44,087

475

Yeah.

00:48:53,927 --> 00:48:56,804

477

488
00:50:51,534 --> 00:50:54,008
That piece of ratshit made Tin Tin

489
00:50:54,094 --> 00:50:56,089
Tin Tin was a dick.

490
00:50:56,176 --> 00:50:59,014
Tin Tin.
Sheesh.

491

Fire it up! Fire it up!

Fire it up!

493
00:51:07,531 --> 00:51:09,535
No Funboy.

494
00:51:09,612 --> 00:51:13,371
Probably still...
banging away on Darla.

495
00:51:18,531 --> 00:51:21,494
Smokes and road beers.
Be quick.

496
00:51:21,571 --> 00:51:23,489
I'm on it.

497
00:51:52,893 --> 00:51:56,327
What the fuck are
you supposed to be, man?

498
00:51:56,413 --> 00:52:00,853
I'm your passenger.

499
00:52:07,451 --> 00:52:09,533
Drive.

500
00:52:14,414 --> 00:52:16,131
What's all this
happy horseshit?

501
00:52:16,207 --> 00:52:18,250
Hey, T-bird! T-bird!

502
00:52:23,448 --> 00:52:26,575
- Oh, shit!
- What the fuck's the matter with you?

503
00:52:26,651 --> 00:52:30,488
Stupid asshair!
You hit my car!

504
00:52:37,172 --> 00:52:41,411
What do you want, man?
Money? Drugs? I got it.

505
00:52:42,974 --> 00:52:45,727
We could use you.
You did Tin Tin.

506
00:52:45,813 --> 00:52:48,767
- This is business, right?
- Faster.

507
00:52:51,615 --> 00:52:55,653
You got that cream stuff?

508
00:52:55,691 --> 00:52:58,012
I hate this.
They can't even call it cream legally.

509
00:52:59,527 --> 00:53:02,414
What in the crap...

510
00:53:05,771 --> 00:53:08,494
Oh, look. Making us popular.

511
00:53:08,533 --> 00:53:11,132
When they flash us like that,
they ain't friends.

512
00:53:16,493 --> 00:53:19,331
This is Vehicle 48. We got us
a big, old, red hot rod.

513
00:53:21,767 --> 00:53:23,849
Turn.

514
00:53:25,134 --> 00:53:27,771
You got something personal, amigo,
we can work it out.

515
00:53:27,848 --> 00:53:32,010
Right? Huh?

516
00:53:33,487 --> 00:53:35,894
Damn! Dead end!

517
00:53:41,054 --> 00:53:43,413
Look out!

518
00:53:46,607 --> 00:53:48,736
Oh, my God!
Get outta the way!

519
00:53:59,371 --> 00:54:03,447
Holy shit! Goddamn foreign cars!

520
00:54:06,967 --> 00:54:09,374
Shit! Shit!

521
00:54:16,212 --> 00:54:19,770
Oh, I hate this.
This ain't good.

522
00:54:21,132 --> 00:54:24,450
T- bird!
I got you, man!

523
00:54:24,527 --> 00:54:26,810
Shit!

524
00:54:39,651 --> 00:54:41,847
Remember?
Yeah, I remember everything.

525
00:54:41,934 --> 00:54:45,050
But I don't know what...
What? Huh? What?

526
00:54:45,089 --> 00:54:47,774
What are you talking about?
No, no, no, no, no.

527
00:54:47,813 --> 00:54:50,814
You mean that place downtown?
Yeah, I remember her.

528
00:54:50,853 --> 00:54:52,934
We needed to put some fear
into that little lady.

529
00:54:53,011 --> 00:54:56,127
She wasn't going along
with our tenant relocation program.

530
00:54:56,214 --> 00:54:59,647
And her idiot boyfriend shows up
and turns a simple sweep-and-clear...

531
00:54:59,733 --> 00:55:03,013
into a total cluster fuck!
Who gives a shit?

532
00:55:03,090 --> 00:55:06,207
It's ancient history!
Why? What do you want?

533
00:55:06,293 --> 00:55:11,012
What is it? What?
Speak to me. Speak!

534
00:55:12,527 --> 00:55:14,330
Did you send us
these complaints?

535
00:55:15,970 --> 00:55:19,173
Come here!
"Abashed the devil stood."

536
00:55:19,211 --> 00:55:21,494
Does it get you sweaty?

537
00:55:21,571 --> 00:55:26,567
I know you. I know you.
I knew I knew you.

538
00:55:26,615 --> 00:55:30,528
I knew I knew you.
But you ain't you.

539
00:55:30,691 --> 00:55:34,451
You can't be you. We put you through
the window. There ain't no coming back.

540
00:55:34,527 --> 00:55:37,855
This is the really real world.
There ain't no coming back.

541
00:55:37,894 --> 00:55:40,167
We killed you dead.
There ain't no coming back.

542
00:55:40,253 --> 00:55:44,530
T- bird...

543
00:55:44,607 --> 00:55:47,455
There ain't no coming back!
There ain't no coming back!

544
00:55:49,891 --> 00:55:53,890
T- bird.

545
00:55:53,967 --> 00:55:57,209
"Abashed the devil stood...

546
00:55:57,247 --> 00:56:00,095
and felt how awful goodness is."

547
00:56:00,172 --> 00:56:02,934
"And felt how awful goodness is."

548
00:56:16,409 --> 00:56:18,893
T- bird. T-bird.

549
00:57:07,209 --> 00:57:09,415
This is the 7:00 a.m. edition
of Action News.

550
00:57:09,492 --> 00:57:11,736
For over a decade,
the night before Halloween...

551
00:57:11,774 --> 00:57:15,975
has had a darker and deadlier nickname
in the inner city, "Devil's Night"...

552
00:57:16,051 --> 00:57:19,331
the name given to what has become
an annual plague of arson.

553
00:57:19,408 --> 00:57:24,568
Last year over 200 blazes were reported,
and 11 people lost their lives.

554
00:57:24,616 --> 00:57:29,574
Tonight may become the biggest
and deadliest Devil's Night ever.

555
00:57:29,651 --> 00:57:33,132
The mayor has fire fighters
from all surrounding counties...

556
00:57:33,209 --> 00:57:36,853
Do you like them up or over?
I can't remember.

557
00:57:38,809 --> 00:57:41,408
What are you doing?
I don't even like eggs.

558
00:57:41,495 --> 00:57:46,213
- Wait, you loved eggs.
- Yeah, when I was five.

559
00:57:46,290 --> 00:57:50,251
So what do you want now?
Black coffee and cigarettes?

560
00:57:50,327 --> 00:57:53,531
So what did you take
to become mother of the year?

561
00:57:53,569 --> 00:57:58,489
Oh, it wasn't drugs.
Someone kind of woke me up.

562
00:57:58,527 --> 00:58:04,090
- Who?
- Oh, it was nuts.

563
00:58:04,128 --> 00:58:09,173
You're acting weird. Did you win
the lottery or something, Darla?

564
00:58:11,570 --> 00:58:15,694
Oh, forget it. I never was
too good at this mommy shit.

565
00:58:15,771 --> 00:58:17,890
Over easy.

566
00:58:19,895 --> 00:58:24,412
I like 'em
over easy... Mom.

567
00:58:34,568 --> 00:58:36,735
Hey, Albrecht.

568
00:58:39,373 --> 00:58:42,173
This is the third hit
in your hood in 24 hours.

569
00:58:42,250 --> 00:58:45,367
We just fished this out of the river.
He's fused to his own car.

570
00:58:45,453 --> 00:58:49,491
- We're gonna have to I.D. his teeth.
- His name is T-bird.

571
00:58:49,567 --> 00:58:51,409
Arson was his specialty.

572
00:58:51,495 --> 00:58:53,375
Looks like he zigged
when he should have zagged.

573
00:58:53,451 --> 00:58:57,211
- Case closed.
- Bull-fuckin'- shit.

574
00:58:57,288 --> 00:58:59,455
Come here.

575
00:59:03,051 --> 00:59:04,931
You're holding out on me.

576
00:59:05,008 --> 00:59:08,412
I got a goddamn vigilante killer
knocking off scumbags left and right...

577
00:59:08,489 --> 00:59:11,616
and you're covering up
for somebody.

578
00:59:11,692 --> 00:59:14,013
Who's the cartoon character
in the painted face?

579
00:59:14,090 --> 00:59:17,811
- You're the detective. You tell me.
- Okay.

580
00:59:17,888 --> 00:59:19,931
Gideon's blows all to hell and you're
having a chitchat with some weirdo...

581
00:59:20,007 --> 00:59:22,769
who winds up in T-bird's car
when it zigs instead of zags.

582
00:59:22,808 --> 00:59:25,646
Then you steal one of
my case files from homicide...

583
00:59:25,733 --> 00:59:27,574
and you're saying this is
just a fucking automobile accident?

584
00:59:27,651 --> 00:59:29,847
- Come on!
- Yeah. Good speech though.

585
00:59:29,933 --> 00:59:31,851
I didn't want to interrupt you.
It sounded good.

586
00:59:31,928 --> 00:59:33,846
You gotta write that shit down.

587
00:59:33,894 --> 00:59:35,774
All right, smart-ass.

588
00:59:35,812 --> 00:59:38,776
The captain's got a little
love note waiting for you.

589
00:59:38,814 --> 00:59:42,612
- Welcome to the first day of the rest of your suspension.
- Suspension?

590
00:59:42,650 --> 00:59:46,247
- For what?
- Misconduct.

591
00:59:46,333 --> 00:59:50,169
Yeah, give me the lab.

592
01:00:38,850 --> 01:00:41,334
One for sorrow,
two for joy...

593
01:00:41,411 --> 01:00:44,134
- Come here.
- ... three for a girl, four for a boy.

594
01:00:48,968 --> 01:00:52,612
Dancing...

595
01:01:22,448 --> 01:01:24,328
Eric?

596
01:01:26,927 --> 01:01:31,050
Man, Sarah,
you're going crazy.

597
01:01:31,089 --> 01:01:33,928
Gabriel.

598
01:01:33,976 --> 01:01:36,651
I thought you were dead.

599
01:01:36,690 --> 01:01:39,854
You're not dead, are you?

600
01:02:03,610 --> 01:02:06,410
I knew it was you.

601
01:02:08,252 --> 01:02:11,052
Even with the makeup.

602
01:02:15,694 --> 01:02:18,168
I remembered your song.

603
01:02:18,254 --> 01:02:21,851
You said,
"Can't rain all the time."

604
01:02:21,928 --> 01:02:25,054
That is from your song, right?

605
01:02:34,568 --> 01:02:37,569
Come on, Eric. I know you're here.

606
01:02:39,852 --> 01:02:43,774
I miss you...
and Shelly.

607
01:02:46,728 --> 01:02:50,047
Get so lonely
all by myself.

608
01:02:51,811 --> 01:02:56,252
The hell with you.
I thought you cared.

609
01:02:56,328 --> 01:02:59,330
Sarah, I do care.

610
01:03:10,091 --> 01:03:12,133
That's him.
That's him!

611
01:03:12,210 --> 01:03:15,413
But he looked different. He was painted
up white like some kind of dead whore.

612
01:03:15,490 --> 01:03:18,607
I seen him. T-bird sent me in
for some road beers, right?

613
01:03:18,693 --> 01:03:21,129
Then he took him away.
But I chased him down.

614
01:03:21,215 --> 01:03:23,891
And he flash fried T-bird
to his fucking car!

615
01:03:23,968 --> 01:03:27,334
Aw, T-bird!
Here's to you, buddy.

616
01:03:27,411 --> 01:03:31,170
Maybe we oughta just videotape this.
Play it back in slow motion.

617
01:03:32,455 --> 01:03:36,848
- Fire it up! Fire it up!
- You see the grave?

618
01:03:36,934 --> 01:03:39,408
- Empty.
- Fire it...

619
01:03:39,495 --> 01:03:41,326
Grave?
What grave?

620
01:03:41,413 --> 01:03:43,532
What about
my fucking grave?

621
01:03:43,609 --> 01:03:44,894
Three out of four.

622
01:03:44,971 --> 01:03:48,088
He's working his way back
to this speed freak right here.

623
01:03:48,174 --> 01:03:50,687
It's not fair.
It's Funboy's fault.

624
01:03:50,773 --> 01:03:53,813
That boy was out of control.
T- bird, he came in, he says...

625
01:03:53,890 --> 01:03:57,055
..."Waste them both." And now
this ghost gonna kill my ass next!

626
01:04:00,929 --> 01:04:03,893
This ghost gonna
kill my ass next.

627
01:04:03,969 --> 01:04:07,575
- This ghost gonna kill...
- Hey.

628
01:04:07,652 --> 01:04:09,532
That ain't no ghost.

629
01:04:11,373 --> 01:04:14,413
- They have all arrived.
- Watch him.

630
01:04:14,452 --> 01:04:16,370
We might need him.

631
01:04:17,808 --> 01:04:20,168
Ghost gonna kill my...

632
01:04:32,367 --> 01:04:36,174
He like his plain
or with onions?

633
01:04:36,212 --> 01:04:39,531
Fine.
Don't talk to me.

634
01:04:39,569 --> 01:04:43,530
When someone's dead,
they can't come back, can they?

635
01:04:43,568 --> 01:04:46,090
That's what I thought.

636
01:04:46,129 --> 01:04:48,814
Are you referring
to anyone in particular?

637
01:04:48,852 --> 01:04:51,049
You'll just think
I'm nuts.

638
01:04:51,087 --> 01:04:54,568
Yeah, well, then maybe
they'll have to lock us both up.

639
01:04:54,655 --> 01:04:59,766
- You see him too?
- I saw somebody.

640
01:04:59,853 --> 01:05:03,209
Maybe it was
your fairy godfather.

641
01:05:03,296 --> 01:05:06,086
Eric didn't come back for me.

642
01:05:06,173 --> 01:05:10,728
He can't be my friend anymore
because I'm alive.

643
01:05:10,814 --> 01:05:13,855
You want a friend
to walk you home?

644
01:06:44,129 --> 01:06:46,929
Boys.

645
01:06:47,006 --> 01:06:50,286
It seems our friend T-bird won't be
joining us this evening...

646
01:06:50,372 --> 01:06:52,367
on account of
a slight case of death.

647
01:06:52,454 --> 01:06:54,333
You wanna sit down?

648
01:06:54,410 --> 01:06:59,570
Well, well, well.

649
01:06:59,608 --> 01:07:02,571
Devil's Night is
upon us again.

650
01:07:02,610 --> 01:07:04,490
I thought we'd throw
a little party...

651
01:07:04,528 --> 01:07:07,693
start a bunch of fires,
make a little profit.

652
01:07:07,731 --> 01:07:09,889
I like the pretty lights.

653
01:07:12,776 --> 01:07:16,535
Problem is, it's all been done before.
You see what I'm saying?

654
01:07:16,573 --> 01:07:21,570
- That's no reason to quit.
- Wrong. Best reason to quit.

655
01:07:21,647 --> 01:07:23,929
Only reason to quit.

656
01:07:24,016 --> 01:07:29,290
A man has an idea.

657
01:07:29,367 --> 01:07:31,534
The idea attracts others...

658
01:07:31,611 --> 01:07:33,616
like-minded.

659
01:07:33,692 --> 01:07:35,687
The idea expands.

660
01:07:35,773 --> 01:07:39,255
The idea becomes
an institution.

661
01:07:39,331 --> 01:07:41,892
What was the idea?

662
01:07:41,969 --> 01:07:45,575
See, that's what's
been bothering me, boys.

663
01:07:45,652 --> 01:07:48,327
But I'll tell ya, when I used
to think about the idea itself...

664
01:07:48,414 --> 01:07:51,367
it'd put a big old smile on my face.

665
01:07:51,454 --> 01:07:53,535
You see, gentlemen...

666
01:07:53,612 --> 01:07:58,407
greed is for amateurs.

667
01:07:58,493 --> 01:08:03,451
Disorder, chaos, anarchy...

668
01:08:03,528 --> 01:08:06,012
now that's fun!

669
01:08:06,089 --> 01:08:08,294
- What about Devil's Night?
- What about it?

670
01:08:08,371 --> 01:08:11,651
I started the first fires
in this goddamn city.

671
01:08:11,689 --> 01:08:14,653
Before I knew it, every charlatan
and shitheel was imitating me.

672
01:08:14,730 --> 01:08:18,048
Do you know
what they got now?

673
01:08:18,086 --> 01:08:22,210
Devil's Night greeting cards.

674
01:08:22,248 --> 01:08:25,087
Isn't that precious?

675
01:08:25,135 --> 01:08:27,168
Yeah.

676
01:08:27,207 --> 01:08:31,810
The idea has become
the institution, boys.

677
01:08:31,848 --> 01:08:33,814
Time to move along.

678
01:08:33,891 --> 01:08:36,212
You don't want us to do
"Light My Fire" time for the whole city?

679
01:08:36,289 --> 01:08:38,686
No.

680
01:08:38,734 --> 01:08:41,247
No, I want you to set
a fire so goddamn big...

681
01:08:41,295 --> 01:08:44,287
the gods will notice us again.
That's what I'm saying.

682
01:08:44,335 --> 01:08:46,848
I want all of you boys to be able
to look me straight in the eye...

683
01:08:46,886 --> 01:08:51,173
one more time and say,
"Are we having fun or what?"

684
01:08:51,211 --> 01:08:53,254
- Hey, you! What's your name?
- Huh?

685
01:08:53,293 --> 01:08:55,172
Skank!
You don't feel that?

686
01:08:55,211 --> 01:08:58,414
- I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook.

687
01:08:58,452 --> 01:09:00,773
"I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook."

688
01:09:00,850 --> 01:09:05,050
Well, boy, your mama
must be damn proud of you!

689
01:09:07,410 --> 01:09:09,932
How the hell did
that thing get in here?

690
01:09:11,294 --> 01:09:13,691
Gentlemen.

691
01:09:13,768 --> 01:09:18,208
Let me go!
Let me go! I gotta go!

692
01:09:22,572 --> 01:09:26,207
You're him, huh?
The avenger.

693
01:09:26,255 --> 01:09:28,652
The killer of killers.

694
01:09:28,729 --> 01:09:31,453
Nice outfit.

695
01:09:31,530 --> 01:09:33,496
I'm not sure
about the face though.

696
01:09:33,572 --> 01:09:35,529
I just want him.

697
01:09:35,615 --> 01:09:38,895
Well, you can't have him.

698
01:09:38,972 --> 01:09:41,532
Well...

699
01:09:43,527 --> 01:09:45,886
I see you have
made your decision.

700
01:09:47,411 --> 01:09:49,291
Now let's see you enforce it.

701
01:09:49,368 --> 01:09:52,887
Aw, this is already boring the shit
out of me. Kill him!

702
01:09:58,526 --> 01:10:02,296
Ooh, that had to hurt.

703
01:10:02,372 --> 01:10:05,048
Well, that's that.

704
01:10:05,134 --> 01:10:08,174
That guy was crazy.

705
01:10:14,533 --> 01:10:16,250
He's gone.

706
01:10:23,970 --> 01:10:25,610
Get him!

707
01:10:42,172 --> 01:10:44,848
Right here! Here, help me!
He's gonna kill me!

708
01:10:48,732 --> 01:10:50,650
Jesus Christ!

709
01:11:06,407 --> 01:11:08,287
Hey!

710
01:11:39,494 --> 01:11:41,729
You're all going to die.

711
01:11:56,134 --> 01:11:58,848
Get the fuck outta here!

712
01:12:33,172 --> 01:12:35,972
Guess it's not a good day
to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?

713
01:12:36,049 --> 01:12:39,127
I'm not Skank.
There's Skank right there.

714
01:12:39,214 --> 01:12:42,935
- Skank's dead.
- That's right.

715
01:12:43,011 --> 01:12:44,728
No!

716
01:12:49,168 --> 01:12:52,688
What in the crap...

717
01:12:53,973 --> 01:12:56,496
- Don't move!
- Hold it!

718
01:12:56,572 --> 01:12:59,852
That's all she wrote!
Move and we shoot!

719
01:13:08,570 --> 01:13:11,332
You are surrounded by police units.
Do not attempt to escape.

720
01:13:14,650 --> 01:13:18,131
- Stop running immediately.
- Holy shit!

721
01:13:18,208 --> 01:13:20,251
...arms and legs...

722
01:13:25,574 --> 01:13:30,167
Stop immediately.
Lie down, spread your arms and legs...

723
01:14:09,133 --> 01:14:13,574
Come on! Move it!

724
01:14:17,813 --> 01:14:20,814
My advice:
Next time duck.

725
01:14:22,771 --> 01:14:25,053
So many cops, you'd think
they were giving away donuts.

726
01:14:28,372 --> 01:14:31,373
Shit!

727
01:14:34,135 --> 01:14:36,926
Oh. I knew you
were gonna do that.

728
01:14:37,013 --> 01:14:39,372
Look at that out there.

729
01:14:39,410 --> 01:14:42,249
The whole city oughta be
in flames by now.

730
01:14:42,287 --> 01:14:45,375
Sky oughta be red.

731
01:14:45,452 --> 01:14:49,614
So that, I take it,
is the late, great Eric Draven.

732
01:14:49,653 --> 01:14:55,129
He has power, but it is power
you can take from him.

733
01:14:55,215 --> 01:14:58,054
- I like him already.
- The crow...

734
01:14:58,131 --> 01:15:02,408
is his link between
the land of the living...

735
01:15:02,494 --> 01:15:04,729
and the realm of the dead.

736
01:15:04,815 --> 01:15:09,169
So, kill the crow
and destroy the man.

737
01:15:09,208 --> 01:15:11,135
Hmm.

738
01:15:33,289 --> 01:15:35,207
I'm coming home, Shelly.

739
01:16:22,286 --> 01:16:24,655
You're gonna say
I shouldn't be in the cemetery...

740
01:16:24,694 --> 01:16:26,688
in the middle
of the night, right?

741
01:16:26,727 --> 01:16:28,453
Safest place in the world to be.

742
01:16:28,491 --> 01:16:33,095
It's 'cause everybody's dead.
I knew you'd come here.

743
01:16:33,133 --> 01:16:37,132
It's really late, Sarah.

744
01:16:37,209 --> 01:16:39,846
You didn't say good-bye.

745
01:16:39,971 --> 01:16:43,769
You're just gonna have
to forgive me for that.

746
01:16:43,855 --> 01:16:47,931
And you're never coming back.

747
01:16:53,973 --> 01:16:57,090
I gave this to Shelly once.

748
01:17:00,648 --> 01:17:03,487
I think she'd like you
to have it.

749
01:17:07,371 --> 01:17:09,567
This way you'll
always remember her.

750
01:17:09,615 --> 01:17:12,089
I'll never take it off.

751
01:17:29,486 --> 01:17:33,169
I better go sneak
back in the house.

752
01:17:39,048 --> 01:17:40,928
Bye.

753
01:18:00,089 --> 01:18:02,813
Shh! Shh!

754
01:18:04,654 --> 01:18:06,975
Shh. Take it easy, sweetheart.

755
01:18:13,612 --> 01:18:15,971
Come on.
Come on.

756
01:18:28,726 --> 01:18:32,687
What is that? Some sort of souvenir
there from your pal?

757
01:18:34,212 --> 01:18:37,214
I'll just keep it for good luck.
What do you say, hmm?

758
01:18:43,371 --> 01:18:46,536
Her eyes are so innocent.

759
01:18:57,411 --> 01:18:59,291
Eric!

760
01:18:59,329 --> 01:19:03,127
Eric, help! Eric!

761
01:19:40,971 --> 01:19:44,049
Quick impression for ya.

762
01:19:44,136 --> 01:19:47,694
Caw! Caw! Bang!
Fuck, I'm dead!

763
01:19:47,770 --> 01:19:50,973
Give me the girl
and I'll let you walk out of here.

764
01:19:51,050 --> 01:19:53,975
Well, well.

765
01:19:54,052 --> 01:19:57,648
Why don't you just give me a minute
to think about that, huh?

766
01:20:05,292 --> 01:20:07,488
Nah. Fuck it.

767
01:20:15,611 --> 01:20:17,654
Aw, fuck.

768
01:20:24,607 --> 01:20:28,971
Well, well, well. It does seem to me
that our little life has undergone...

769
01:20:29,047 --> 01:20:32,730
a rather significant change in the past
few minutes now. Wouldn't you agree?

770
01:20:36,892 --> 01:20:40,134
Well, for a ghost,
you bleed just fine.

771
01:20:43,529 --> 01:20:45,687
- It's still alive.
- Well, then kill it!

772
01:20:47,288 --> 01:20:49,408
Bye-bye, birdie.

773
01:21:32,651 --> 01:21:34,694
Ah, shit.

774
01:21:34,732 --> 01:21:36,775
Well, just came by
to pay my respects...

775
01:21:36,813 --> 01:21:38,770
and here you are
getting all shot up again.

776
01:21:38,846 --> 01:21:41,330
- They've taken Sarah.
- How many?

777
01:21:41,407 --> 01:21:43,335
Two more.

778
01:21:43,373 --> 01:21:45,291
I can handle it.
Don't worry.

779
01:21:45,368 --> 01:21:47,813
I'm not worried.
Look, here's the plan.

780
01:21:47,852 --> 01:21:50,527
You stay in front, and when they
run out of ammo, I'll arrest 'em.

781
01:21:50,575 --> 01:21:54,172
That sounds like a great plan.
There's just one problem.

782
01:21:56,694 --> 01:22:00,089
Oh, shit.
You're bleeding all over the place.

783
01:22:00,175 --> 01:22:02,132
I thought, you know,
you were invincible.

784
01:22:02,208 --> 01:22:05,527
I was.
I'm not anymore.

785
01:22:05,613 --> 01:22:09,651
Well, I guess you really will
need my help, won't you?

786
01:22:09,727 --> 01:22:12,528
Come on.

787
01:22:15,088 --> 01:22:17,054
You take that.

788
01:22:45,893 --> 01:22:49,211
- You were supposed to stay behind me.
- I think I messed up.

789
01:23:12,333 --> 01:23:15,450
This is all the power
you ever had.

790
01:23:15,489 --> 01:23:17,531
Now it is mine.

791
01:23:17,570 --> 01:23:21,128
Pity there's not more time...

792
01:23:21,214 --> 01:23:23,727
...for us.

793
01:23:41,133 --> 01:23:43,848
Help, Eric!
I'm scared!

794
01:23:45,890 --> 01:23:48,326
Let me go!

795
01:23:57,054 --> 01:24:00,449
Let her go!

796
01:24:00,487 --> 01:24:03,287
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

797
01:24:03,287 --> 01:24:04,927
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

798
01:24:04,975 --> 01:24:06,893
All right.

799
01:24:06,970 --> 01:24:08,926
No!

800
01:24:53,455 --> 01:24:54,855
Eric!

801
01:25:12,693 --> 01:25:15,887
- Sarah?
- Look out!

802
01:25:19,330 --> 01:25:22,686
Eric!

803
01:25:30,368 --> 01:25:32,449
You know,
my daddy used to say...

804
01:25:32,536 --> 01:25:34,933
"Every man's got a devil...

805
01:25:35,010 --> 01:25:37,053
and you can't rest
till you find him."

806
01:25:37,129 --> 01:25:39,575
What happened back there
with you and your girlfriend...

807
01:25:39,652 --> 01:25:42,452
I cleared that building.

808
01:25:42,529 --> 01:25:45,655
Hell, nothing in this town
happens without my say-so.

809
01:25:45,732 --> 01:25:48,456
So I'm sorry if I spoiled
your wedding plans, friend.

810
01:25:48,532 --> 01:25:51,246
But if it's any consolation
to you...

811
01:25:51,333 --> 01:25:54,814
you have put
a smile on my face.

812
01:25:54,891 --> 01:25:57,413
You got a lot
of spirit, son.

813
01:25:57,451 --> 01:25:59,974
I am going to miss you.

814
01:26:00,012 --> 01:26:02,448
I have something
to give you.

815
01:26:02,534 --> 01:26:04,807
I don't want it anymore.

816
01:26:09,133 --> 01:26:12,010
Thirty hours of pain!

817
01:26:14,254 --> 01:26:16,853
All at once!

818
01:26:16,930 --> 01:26:19,807
All for you.

819
01:26:44,368 --> 01:26:47,408
Yeah.

820
01:26:53,968 --> 01:26:56,691
Go help him.

821
01:26:59,895 --> 01:27:02,091
Are you alive?

822
01:27:04,009 --> 01:27:07,855
God, I need a cigarette.

823
01:27:13,570 --> 01:27:15,450
Everybody else dead?

824
01:27:15,488 --> 01:27:17,694
You helped me.

825
01:27:17,771 --> 01:27:20,207
What you kept in here
saved me.

826
01:27:20,293 --> 01:27:23,295
- Thanks.
- Don't mention it.

827
01:27:23,372 --> 01:27:26,249
I've been meaning
to come to church anyway.

828
01:27:31,054 --> 01:27:33,691
Oh, yuck.

829
01:27:33,768 --> 01:27:38,573
I'm quitting as of now...
if I live.

830
01:27:46,696 --> 01:27:50,014
Stay with him
until help comes.

831
01:27:50,052 --> 01:27:53,371
He'll be okay, right?

832
01:27:53,447 --> 01:27:55,567
Eric?

833
01:27:56,967 --> 01:28:00,410
He does that a lot.

834
01:28:16,014 --> 01:28:18,373
Shelly.

835
01:28:30,092 --> 01:28:34,734
- All right, what's going on in there?
- Multiple homicides.

836
01:28:34,811 --> 01:28:37,410
At least it stopped raining, huh?

837
01:28:37,448 --> 01:28:40,728
- It can't rain all the time.
- No, I don't believe it.

838
01:28:40,814 --> 01:28:44,008
- This nightmare your fault, Albrecht?
- Look, you go on home.

839
01:28:44,046 --> 01:28:45,936
- I'm okay.
- Okay.

840
01:28:45,974 --> 01:28:50,366
- Want to tell me what's going on?
- Your vigilante's up on the roof.

841
01:28:50,453 --> 01:28:52,409
You missed it.

842
01:28:52,495 --> 01:28:55,046
Get him outta here!

843
01:29:56,607 --> 01:29:58,487
Thanks.

844
01:30:03,493 --> 01:30:06,409
If the people we love
are stolen from us...

845
01:30:06,495 --> 01:30:11,367
the way to have them live on
is to never stop loving them.

846
01:30:11,453 --> 01:30:17,092
Buildings burn, people die,
but real love is forever.
